data.question: What is the chemical formula of the tetrahedral cage constructed in the study?
What property of the Ti4L6 cage is highlighted by its ability to dissolve in water and DMF/H2O solution?
What unique feature does the Ti4L6 cage exhibit that allows it to trap other metal ions?
What phenomenon was observed in the Ti4L6 cage related to its titanium compositions?
How does the Ti4L6 cage recognize C3-symmetric dye molecules?
What was the outcome of using the Ti4L6 cage for photodecomposition of acid blue 93 and alkali blue 4B?
data.answer: Selective and efficient homogeneous photodecomposition was achieved

data.question: Is the Ti4L6 cage water-soluble?
Does the Ti4L6 cage exhibit a mixed-valence phenomenon of Ti3+/4+ compositions?
Can the Ti4L6 cage act as a visible-light-active homogeneous photocatalyst?
Was the Ti4L6 cage found to be unstable in water?
Did the study find that the Ti4L6 cage could not trap metal ions?
Is the Ti4L6 cage ineffective in the photodecomposition of dye molecules?
Does the Ti4L6 cage lack coordination-active vertices?
What method was used to confirm the high stability of the Ti4L6 cage after dissolution?
What was used to investigate the electronic characteristics of the metal ions in the prepared cage compounds?
data.answer: Electron spin resonance (ESR) analysis and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) studies

data.question: What was the result of the photocatalytic selectivity test of the Ti4L6 cage?
data.answer: It was selective towards AB-93 and AB-4B due to molecular recognition

data.question: What was the role of organic amines in the production of Ti3+ ions within the Ti4L6 cage?
data.answer: Organic amines were suggested to have reductive activities under solvothermal conditions, contributing to the production of Ti3+ ions

data.question: Was the Ti4L6 cage found to be non-soluble in water?

Was the Ti4L6 cage found to be ineffective in trapping Co or Ln ions?
